column4: hello, SSL isn't enabled for some reason, and thus I can't log into yahoo.com e-mail or any where that requires a secure connection :(
My uname -a output is Linux jescis-desktop 2.6.22-14-generic #1 SMP Tue Feb 12 07:42:25 UTC 2008 i686 GNU/Linux
ummm have you checked your browser configs ?
I'm using firefox, and don't know where it's at :(
under the edit menu ?
preferences ?
edit->preferences->advanced->encryption ?
it's marked :\*confused*
then I don't know what else could be the issue
you can always try 'mv .mozilla old.mozilla` from your home directory and restart firefox .. don't know what else to do
and you moved the .mozilla folder ?
here's an image of the error: http://imagebin.ca/view/sJ7JjSG.html
for grins and giggles .. open up a terminal and do ... mv .mozilla old.mozilla
restart firefox
now it works, thanks :)
you understand what you did ?
your configurations and settings and cache are stored in a directory named '.mozilla' .. when you removed it .. it was like re-setting your settings :)
teach a person how to fish .....
man fstab ?
wwops ..wrong person
yeah, if only I thought of it myself though. Of course it's good to get help when you get stuck, and don't have the faintest idea how to do something.
now you now .. and if you do `ls -a` you can see all your . files :)
files/folders that begin with a dot are hidden unless you do ls -a
*DOH* .. sorry .. I ferget how to do things ala GUI :-/
